sentences.sContent: She had no inhibitions about saying what she felt.
sentences.sCn: 她毫不顾忌地说出自己的感觉。

sentences.sContent: People tend to lose their inhibitions when they’ve drunk a lot of alcohol.
sentences.sCn: 人们在喝多了酒之后往往会无所顾忌。

synos.tran: [心理][电子][通信]抑制；压抑；禁止

phrases.pCn: 竞争性抑制；竞争性抑制作用

words.tran: [助剂] 抑制剂，抗化剂；抑制者

trans.tranOther: a feeling of shyness or embarrassment that stops you doing or saying what you really want
